title: Goldman cuts U.S. growth forecast after Sen. Joe Manchin rejects Biden's $2 trillion spending plan
text:
These are the big levels to watch for the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. Expect ‘wild trade,' if they break, warns this strategist.

As a risk-off day gets under way, our call of the day from Miller Tabak & Co.'s Matt Maley lays out all the levels investors need to watch out for in coming sessions. See full story.

‘Nobody was expecting omicron — this one really was a curveball:' Francis Collins, National Institutes of Health outgoing director, shares a parting warning

'I'm worried and I know people are tired of this. I'm tired of this, but the virus is not tired of us,' he said. See full story.

Cathie Wood says stocks have corrected into ‘deep value territory' and won't let benchmarks ‘hold our strategies hostage'

ARK Invest founder Cathie Wood offers the latest defense of once-highflying, disruptive innovation strategies that had made her the toast of Wall Street in 2020. See full story.

6 reasons why ‘Spider-Man: No Way Home' smashed box-office expectations this weekend

Opening weekend estimates for “Spider-Man: No Way Home,” which swung into U.S. theaters on Friday, were a stunning $253 million in ticket sales -- far above the $130 million to $200 million range based on ticket presales. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

'She manages our daily expenses and my wife is really cheap, which I adore.' See full story.
